updateResult

private boolean updateResult(java.lang.String word,
                             java.lang.String jobNodePath)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                             org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException,
                             java.lang.InterruptedException
Updates the given plain text as the result related to the job at given job path or result path Also performs clean up on the job node.

Parameters:
jobNodePath - Either the path of the job node or the path of job node's result node
word - Plaintext found as the result of lookup
Returns:
True if the updating operation was successful
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException
java.lang.InterruptedException

cleanupJob

private void cleanupJob(java.lang.String jobNodePath)
                 throws org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException,
                        java.lang.InterruptedException,
                        java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Cleans up the job node associated with the given path Removes this path from the watch list of the tracker

Parameters:
jobNodePath - Path to the job node or path the result node inside it
Throws:
org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException
java.lang.InterruptedException
java.io.IOException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

isAllPartitionDone

private boolean isAllPartitionDone(java.lang.String jobNodePath)
                            throws org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException,
                                   java.lang.InterruptedException
Given a job node, it checks if all partition nodes inside it are done (deleted)

Parameters:
jobNodePath - Job node to look into. Will get wrong result if it's not a job node path
Returns:
True if all job partitions and their locks have been removed, but no result was found
Throws:
org.apache.zookeeper.KeeperException
java.lang.InterruptedException

checkJobPartitionNode

private java.lang.String checkJobPartitionNode(java.lang.String path)
Parameters:
path - Job node partition to check
Returns:
If the given path is a path to a job partition node or its lock, returns the parsed job node. Null otherwise
